com.worxforus.net

Class NetAuthentication

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.worxforus.net.NetAuthentication

  • public class NetAuthentication
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to contain the login credentials in memory and to handle actual responses to the network to/from login attempts Usage requires NetAuthentication.NetAuthenticationHelper to be subclassed
    Author:
    sbossen

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  NetAuthentication.NetAuthenticationHelper

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static NetResult authenticate(java.lang.String host, NetAuthentication.NetAuthenticationHelper authHelper)
      Use this function after calling loadUsername and loadPassword Run inside a separate thread using Runnable or ASyncTask since the network calls may block for a while The NetHelper interface is used to attempt access multiple retries if needed
      static NetAuthentication getInstance() 
      static int getLoginStatus()
      Returns the results of whether the login was successful.
      static int getUsernum()
      Returns the last authenticated user - does not reset on invalidate (ie.
      static void invalidate()
      Mark logged in cache as invalid - so it will be rechecked next time authenticate is called
      static boolean isCurrentAuthenticationValid()
      Returns true if the cache value looks ok and we think we are still logged in.
      static boolean isReadyForLogin()
      This function returns true if there is a username or accessToken (or other token) present that allows for the system to attempt a login.
      static void loadAccessToken(java.lang.String token, java.lang.String uuid) 
      static void loadUsernamePassword(java.lang.String user, java.lang.String pass) 
      static void reset()
      Call this function whenever the login information changes or login can be re-queried.

      • getLoginStatus

        public static int getLoginStatus()
        Returns the results of whether the login was successful.
        Returns:

      • getUsernum

        public static int getUsernum()
        Returns the last authenticated user - does not reset on invalidate (ie. failed authentication)
        Returns:

      • loadAccessToken

        public static void loadAccessToken(java.lang.String token,
                   java.lang.String uuid)

      • authenticate

        public static NetResult authenticate(java.lang.String host,
                     NetAuthentication.NetAuthenticationHelper authHelper)
        Use this function after calling loadUsername and loadPassword Run inside a separate thread using Runnable or ASyncTask since the network calls may block for a while The NetHelper interface is used to attempt access multiple retries if needed
        Returns:
        NetResult - NetResult.success tells if the login worked or not

      • isCurrentAuthenticationValid

        public static boolean isCurrentAuthenticationValid()
        Returns true if the cache value looks ok and we think we are still logged in. Returns false if not.
        Returns:

      • reset

        public static void reset()
        Call this function whenever the login information changes or login can be re-queried.

      • invalidate

        public static void invalidate()
        Mark logged in cache as invalid - so it will be rechecked next time authenticate is called

      • isReadyForLogin

        public static boolean isReadyForLogin()
        This function returns true if there is a username or accessToken (or other token) present that allows for the system to attempt a login.
        Returns:
